means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 诺尔地貌名称，或住所名称，来源于古英语，含义是“山顶”(top of a hill)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 诺尔来源于古英语别名，身材短粗者

sentence.Network_en: Silver had terrible hard work getting up the knoll.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于希尔弗来说,爬上那小山丘真不是件容易事.

sentence.Network_en: He crawled up a small knoll and surveyed the prospect.
sentence.Network_cn: 他慢腾腾地登上一个小丘,看了看周围的地形.

sentence.Network_en: John Terry was actually the gunman on the grassy knoll.
sentence.Network_cn: 特里其实就是躲在碧草丘上刺杀肯尼迪的凶手.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cnoll 'hilltop', of Germanic origin; related to German Knolle 'clod, lump, tuber' and Dutch knol 'tuber, turnip'
Middle English: probably an imitative alteration of knell

entry.def: A knoll is a low hill with gentle slopes and a rounded top.
